title: Doug Larsen, North Dakota State Senator, and Family Die in Plane Crash
description: The senator, Doug Larsen, a Republican, was piloting the single-engine plane that crashed almost immediately after taking off from an airport in Moab, Utah, on Sunday.

title: Key Takeaways From the First Day of Trump’s Civil Fraud Trial
description: New York’s attorney general filed the lawsuit accusing the former president of inflating the value of his assets. She seeks a $250 million penalty and other punishments.

title: Why MAGA Wants to Betray Ukraine
description: Whatever they may say, it’s not about the money.

title: Trump’s Fraud Trial Begins
description: Also, a threat to oust Speaker Kevin McCarthy. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: A Couple Revives a Scottish Villa After Accidentally Buying It
description: After becoming the inadvertent owners of a crumbling building in rural Scotland, a couple spent five years reviving it. With a little help.

title: What We Know About the NY Trump Fraud Case Ruling
description: New York’s attorney general, Letitia James, sued the former president using a state law that grants her wide powers to pursue corporate wrongdoing.

title: Democrats Weigh Whether to Rescue McCarthy From G.O.P. Ouster Bid
description: Party officials said that without promises to address their policy priorities, the speaker should not count on Democratic votes to save him.

title: Echo Brown, Young Adult Author and Performer, Dies at 39
description: A one-woman show that used her date with a white hipster to talk about life, race, love and sex, led an editor to sign her to write two novels.

title: Democrats Weigh Whether to Rescue McCarthy From G.O.P. Ouster Bid
description: Party officials said that without promises to address their policy priorities, the speaker should not count on Democratic votes to save him.

title: On First Day of New Term, Justices Hear Debate Over Reducing Mass Incarceration
description: The justices heard arguments about how to interpret part of the law aimed at reducing prison sentences for people convicted of certain nonviolent drug crimes.

title: Great Books Will Always Be Their Own Best Defense
description: I read banned books. So does almost everybody else.

title: Kevin McCarthy Surprised Us All
description: Does this mean there’s a sanity caucus out there for the taking?

title: The Americans Most Threatened by Eviction: Young Children
description: About a quarter of Black babies and toddlers in rental households face the threat of eviction in a typical year, a new study says, and all children are disproportionately at risk.

title: Trump’s Fraud Trial Starts With Attacks on Attorney General and Judge
description: Donald J. Trump appeared in court as lawyers for New York’s attorney general, Letitia James, painted him as a fraudster. His lawyers said she was out to get the former president.

title: My Fellow Republicans Need to Grow Up
description: A former member of Congress has advice for his fellow Republicans who are considering ousting Speaker McCarthy.

title: Laphonza Butler, Gavin Newsom’s Senate Appointee: What to Know
description: Ms. Butler, 44, was chosen on Sunday to fill the vacancy created by the death of Senator Dianne Feinstein.

title: Secretary of State Blinken Plays the Guitar to Launch “Music Diplomacy” Initiative
description: A viral video of Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken introduced Americans to the guitar geek hidden within.

title: Horace Ové, Pioneering Black Filmmaker in Britain, Dies at 86
description: His feature-length film, “Pressure,” mapped the struggles of Black Britons in an era of unyielding racism. He was knighted in 2022.

title: Supreme Court Turns Away Challenge to New York’s Rent Regulations
description: Landlords had argued that a rent-stabilization law that covers about a million units is an unconstitutional government taking of private property.

title: Clarence Thomas Recuses as Supreme Court Rejects Trump Lawyer’s Appeal
description: John Eastman, a conservative lawyer who had advised President Donald J. Trump, had sought to wipe out a decision that he said had harmed his reputation and that of his client.

title: NYC Schools Began to Recover From the Pandemic. Now a New Crisis Looms
description: The city faces billions in financial pressures in the coming years that threaten to worsen inequality across the nation’s largest school system.

title: McCarthy’s Speakership Is in Jeopardy as Gaetz Renews Threat to Oust Him
description: Speaker Kevin McCarthy faces a major test of his leadership in the days ahead, after one of his loudest Republican critics in the House reiterated a promise to try to remove him from his post.

title: China Evergrande’s Founder: The Rise and Fall of Hui Ka Yan
description: Hui Ka Yan, who grew up poor in the countryside, was a symbol of China’s economic rise. With Evergrande teetering, his future is uncertain, too.

title: Swifties Watch Their Hero and Learn to Love the N.F.L.
description: As two of America’s biggest fandoms collide, the pop star’s biggest fans are studying up and cheering along.

title: Swifties Watch Their Hero and Learn to Love the N.F.L.
description: As two of America’s biggest fandoms collide, the pop star’s biggest fans are studying up and cheering along.

title: Sarah Burton’s Final Collection for Alexander McQueen
description: Sarah Burton says goodbye to Alexander McQueen with a triumphant collection; Gabriela Hearst departs Chloé.

title: Now Republicans Are Trying to Redefine Abortion Itself
description: With post-Roe outrage showing no sign of waning, strategists on the right are pushing a new lexicon on abortion.

title: Maybe in Your Lifetime, People Will Live on the Moon and Then Mars
description: Through partnerships and 3-D printing, NASA is plotting how to build houses on the moon by 2040.

title: Met Museum’s Great Hall Store to Become Gallery
description: A renovation will create more exhibition space for the popular Costume Institute show as well as a new store and restaurant at the plaza level.
